newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Avalanche kills three people in Swiss Alps.
newsitem.headline: Avalanche kills three people in Swiss Alps.

text.p: Three people were killed by an avalanche on Friday in Engelberg, a popular ski resort in central Switzerland, the Swiss news agency SDA said.
The avalanche engulfed a group of six skiers -- five on snowboards and one on skis -- but three survived after pulling themselves free.
One of the dead, a 58-year-old Swiss, was discovered by rescue crews late on Friday. The other two, a 23-year-old and 27-year-old from the Canton of Zurich, were found during the night, SDA said.
The avalanche on Friday afternoon was triggered by the off-piste skiers themselves.
Jochstock is at the foot of the Titlis mountain, a popular destination for skiers and tourists, especially from Japan.
Full-scale rescue efforts involved around 200 people, 19 dogs and at least five helicopters. Floodlights were used during the night.
Since the start of the skiing season late last year, at least 19 people have been killed in Switzerland by avalanches.
